title.narrative: OUTPUT 9: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: Capacity of Government is improved to implement national strategies for Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) in institutions, which contributes to Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: More children and their families have access to basic sanitation, supported by more effective national strategies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity of Government is improved to implement national strategies for WASH in institutions

description.narrative: WASH in Institutions is a core area of UNICEF support. In 2019, 312 institutions benefitted from WASH interventions with UNICEF support, among which were 34 health facilities. 150,755 children (74,317 girls and 76,438 boys) accessed menstrual hygiene management information across 278 schools and 44,034 children (21,544 girls and 22,460 boys) from 159 schools benefited from child-friendly WASH facilities. UNICEF also supported updating WASH indicators in EMIS, and development of a draft costed strategy for WASH in Healthcare facilities. Play-based hygiene approaches implemented in schools reached both children and communities on promoting safe sanitation and hygiene practices. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2020
